sectionText: This class will take place in 3269 at Beckman Institute.  Neuroscience I and II is required for all first year graduate students in the Neuroscience Program.  The purpose of the course is to introduce students to the breadth and inter-disciplinary nature of the field, and to the topic areas investigated broadly by faculty of the Neuroscience Program.  The course emphasizes concepts and methods rather than facts, and includes discussions and career development lectures.   The course is team taught by multiple NSP faculty, senior students and postdocs.
